document_data.name: Luthness
document_data.mainbody: '''Luthness''' was a gallery owner of expensive artwork in [[Innarlith]] on the [[Lake of Steam]] in the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Possessions: He was in possession of very expensive sculptures.
document_data.History:
In the {{YearlinkName|1364}}, he sold a [[Kozakura]]n sculpture called "[[Small Evil Deity Crouches in the Running Stream, Mindful of Its Breathing]]" to [[Willem Korvan]], who was trying to get it to impress [[Phyrea]], the daughter of [[Inthelph]], his patron. Luthness sold the sculpture for 45,000 [[gold pieces]]. The sculpture had been crafted by [[Akira Tanaka]].

[[Marek Rymüt]], a clandestine [[Red Wizards|Red Wizard]] in Innarlith, was also a customer at his store.
